chapter.title: OpenAM Changes & Deprecated Functionality
chapter.para: This chapter covers both major changes to existing functionality, and also deprecated and removed functionality.

listitem.para: The applications REST endpoint has changed.
With the introduction of resource types into the policy model the /json/applications endpoint has changed, and the REST resource version upped to 2.0.

Version 2.0 of the endpoint includes a new resourceTypeUuids field in the JSON representation of applications, which holds the UUIDs of the associated resource types. The resources and actions fields have been removed. Version 1.0 of the endpoint is unchanged, providing backwards compatibility.
Any existing applications will be converted to use the version 2.0 JSON representation when upgrading OpenAM instances.

The policies REST endpoint has changed.
With the introduction of resource types into the policy model the /json/policies endpoint has changed, and the REST resource version upped to 2.0.

Version 2.0 of the endpoint includes a new resourceTypeUuid field in the JSON representation of policies, which holds the UUID of the associated resource type. Version 1.0 of the endpoint is unchanged, providing backwards compatibility.
Any existing policies will be converted to use the version 2.0 JSON representation when upgrading OpenAM instances.
/json/policies endpoint v2.0

The users REST endpoint has changed.

Versions 1.2 and 2.1 of the endpoint include a new roles field in the JSON representation of a user, with a value of ui-admin, if an administrator is querying their own user details. Versions 1.1 and 2.0 of the endpoint are unchanged.

The OAuth 2.0 plugin interface for custom scopes, Scope is deprecated and likely to be removed in a future release.
Custom OAuth 2.0 scopes plugins now implement the ScopeValidator interface instead. For an example, see the Developer's Guide chapter, Customizing OAuth 2.0 Scope Handling.
The OAuth 2.0 plugin interface for custom response types, ResponseType is deprecated and likely to be removed in a future release.
Custom OAuth 2.0 response type plugins now implement the ResponseTypeHandler interface instead.

section.title: Functionality Deprecated Since OpenAM 10
section.para: The following functionality was deprecated in OpenAM 10, and is likely to be removed in a future release.

listitem.para: With the implementation of OAuth 2.0 in this release, OAuth 1.0 has been deprecated. OAuth 1.0 support was originally provided in OpenAM 9.
The Netscape LDAP API is to be removed from OpenAM, with OpenAM using the OpenDJ LDAP SDK instead. This affects all classes in com.sun.identity.shared.ldap.* packages.
OpenAM currently uses Sun Java System Application Framework (JATO). JATO is deprecated and is likely to be replaced in a future release.
The "Persistent Cookie (Legacy)" settings in the Core Authentication module have been removed. Configure persistent cookies with the Persistent Cookie module.

The Distributed Authentication User Interface (DAUI) has been removed from OpenAM ${serverDocTargetVersion}. You can deploy OpenIG or another reverse proxy to secure OpenAM in a firewall. For more information, see Protecting Network Access.
